heading: stocks hammered, bond rates soar
subheading: the stock market takes a beating on friday as warm feelings about inflation fade. internet stocks lead the decline. meanwhile, bond rates rise.
author: reuters
text: stocks were hammered on friday as a rally on good inflation news faded and wall street fretted over the latest surge in bond interest rates to the highest level in more than a year. based on early and unofficial data, the dow jones industrial average closed off 130.76 points, or 1.23 percent, at 10,490.51 after reversing an early rally of more than 70 points.in the broader market, declining issues beat advances 16 to 12 on active volume of 690 million shares on the new york stock exchange.the nasdaq composite index was down 36.50 points, or 1.47 percent, at 2,448.12, with internet stocks leading the decline."the yield on the 30-year bond is at the highest in almost two years. that's not good for the stock market, and it's showing," said dan matthisson, head trader for d.e. shaw securities in new york.stocks slid despite the tame inflation numbers, which were released early on friday.the bond market reacted to rumors that the federal reserve was holding an emergency meeting to deal with a troubled hedge fund. a fed spokesman declined to comment on the rumor as a matter of policy.the yield on the closely watched 30-year us treasury bond jumped to the highest level since december 1997, standing at 6.14 percent, up from 6.07 percent in late trading thursday.stocks moved higher early in the day after the commerce department reported that the producer price index edged up just 0.2 percent in may. excluding food and energy, the index was up only 0.1 percent.copyright
